answers.answer: Discharge like that is normal during pregnancy. And an increase in it is normal as well. If you suspect that you are pregnant, you would more than likely wanna test sooner than 12 weeks because you need to be taking prenatals and getting the care you will need for you and your baby.
If you are about 5 weeks along, you should test positive by now. I would recommend taking another test and if its negative see a Dr.
I agree, take another test, I've had pregnancy symptoms and missed period before, only for it to turn out I wasn't pregnant. You need to be seen by a doc as early as possible if you are pregnant.

i agree you definetly should take another test within a week span it can change positive or remain negative and all those symptoms can be related to an oncoming period.  also you are so young you should find out, you can make an appointment with your doctor for bloodwork so either you can start prenatal care or discuss other options. trust me coming from another teen mom you need to get a good support system going for any decision you're gonna make.....good luck!

I agree with the others, take a test now and if you can get one try a digital like clear blue which are very accurate (i got a positive early on) you want to make sure to get prenatal care now because being young you have a higher risk for complications like preeclampsia, preterm labor, and other things.take vitamins and folic acid (get it at the pharmacy it's with vitamins) and if you are NOT preggo then get on some birth control. it's so tough to have a baby young and if you can prevent it you should until your old enough to support yourself and the child :)

definitely take another test prior to when you think you would be 12 weeks and if it's negative get to a doctor. a lot of early pregnancy symptoms are the same as menstrual.if you are pregnant....start reading as many baby books as possible, get started on prenatals and figure out what you and the father are going to do.if you're not pregnant...i would highly suggest b/c AND condoms or not having sex (birth control and condoms are not 100% effective. the only sure fire way of not getting pregnant is to not have sex) until you're financially stable and mentally mature enough to care for a baby. (i'm 25 with 21 month old twins and it's taxing on me....)

Basically you need to get checked, 15 is very young. I cant talk I am 17 and been pregnant twice I had a termination because I simply wasnt ready, living in a refuge and had an eating disorder, nd running from a domestic violence issue for the 6th time of my life, and also losing my boyfriend of 2 years (back togetther now) then had a miscarrige. But you NEED to get checked and take another test, you can get false negative results but i suggest a blood test.Just think you DO have your whole life ahead of you....All the best

I agree with the other ladies.  If you are atleast 5 weeks pregnant it would definately show up on a test by this point.  It would be adviseable to take another test, either a home test or at a doctors or clinics.Your symptoms, while they ARE symptoms of pregnancy, they can also be symptoms of puberty as well.  At 15 your body is still working on adjusting hormone production to regulate your cycle.  Hormones can cause our bodies to do all kinds of crazy things.  Have you missed your period?  If so how many?  Again that can be a normal part of puberty as well.  My 13 yo daughter started her period almost a year ago and hers are still very unregular and she has all kinds of weird symptoms going on.Please take another test and let us know how it goes.  Good luck!

Btw pregnant or not, white/clear discharge is completely normal.  These are the secretions from the cervix and are known as cervical mucus.  This discharge during your normal cycle will change consistancy and amount throughout the month.  It can range from non existent to creamy, sticky or even look like egg-whites.  During pregnancy many women will experience an increased amount of creamy white-lotion like discharge.  For some women it's a barely noticeable increase wihle for others it's so much it requires the use of panty liners.

Also you're only 15 and like everyone has said still grown. my sisters had her first period when she was 11 and then didnt have another for 5 months, then had one then didnt have one for 9 months and stuff like that.but you should take a test ASAP!

question: ok im 15 and im pretty sure im pregnant... if i am, then im about 5 weeks along... i have all the symptoms of early pregnancy (sickness, bloating, mood swings, munchies ect) ... i took a pregnancy test about 2 weeks after conception and ofcourse it came out negitive cus of it being so early... i plan on taking another test after 12 weeks... but the only thing im curious is that i have a white/clear discharge that i noticed in my underwar...i was just wondering if thats normal during pregnancy.
title: 15 and pregnant
